001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.BatchLossFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.DimensionLossFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.LossFunction;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.SampleLossFunction;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012import java.util.List;
013
014/**
015 * Represents an objective function that extends the concept of a
016 * {@link LossFunction} to provide both loss aggregation and gradient
017 * computation.
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * An {@code ObjectiveFunction} defines how the overall loss is calculated
021 * across a batch of samples, as well as how the gradients are determined
022 * for optimization algorithms (e.g., stochastic gradient descent).
023 * </p>
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Unlike {@link DimensionLossFunction}, {@link SampleLossFunction}, or
027 * {@link BatchLossFunction}, which focus on specific granularities,
028 * an objective function typically provides the entry point for a training
029 * process, combining loss evaluation and gradient calculation in one place.
030 * </p>
031 */
032@DomainObject
033@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
034public interface ObjectiveFunction extends LossFunction {
035
036    /**
037     * Calculates the loss for a batch of samples.
038     *
039     * <p>
040     * Each sample in the batch is represented as a {@link Pair} of
041     * {@code float[]} arrays, where the left element is the estimated
042     * (predicted) values and the right element is the target
043     * (expected) values. Implementations should define how individual
044     * sample losses are aggregated into a single scalar loss for the batch.
045     * </p>
046     *
047     * @param batch a list of samples, where each sample is a pair of
048     *              {@code float[]} arrays (estimated vs target)
049     * @return the aggregated loss value for the batch
050     */
051    float calculateLoss(List<Pair<Float[], Float[]>> batch);
052
053    /**
054     * Determines the gradients of the objective function with respect to
055     * the estimated values, for a single sample.
056     *
057     * <p>
058     * Implementations should return a gradient array that corresponds in
059     * length and order to the {@code estimated} array, such that each entry
060     * can be used to update model parameters during optimization.
061     * </p>
062     *
063     * @param samples   the total number of samples in the batch
064     * @param estimated the predicted values for a sample
065     * @param target    the expected target values for the sample
066     * @return an array of gradients, one per dimension of the input
067     */
068    Float[] calculateGradient_dJ_da(int samples, Float[] estimated, Float[] target);
069
070    /**
071     * Creates an {@link ObjectiveFunction} that minimizes the loss
072     * according to the given loss function components.
073     *
074     * <p>
075     * This factory method composes together a {@link BatchLossFunction},
076     * a {@link SampleLossFunction}, and one or more
077     * {@link DimensionLossFunction}s into a concrete
078     * {@link ObjectiveFunction} implementation. The resulting objective
079     * function calculates dimension-level errors, aggregates them into
080     * sample losses, and then aggregates those sample losses into a
081     * batch-level loss suitable for optimization.
082     * </p>
083     *
084     * <p>
085     * The intent of this method is to provide a convenient entry point
086     * for constructing custom objective functions when the optimization
087     * goal is loss minimization (as is typical in regression and
088     * classification problems).
089     * </p>
090     *
091     * @param batchLossFunction      the function used to aggregate losses
092     *                               across the entire batch
093     * @param sampleLossFunction     the function used to aggregate losses
094     *                               within a single sample
095     * @param dimensionLossFunctions one or more functions used to compute
096     *                               loss at the individual dimension level
097     * @return a composed {@link ObjectiveFunction} that minimizes loss
098     */
099    static ObjectiveFunction minimize(BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction, SampleLossFunction sampleLossFunction, DimensionLossFunction... dimensionLossFunctions) {
100        return new ObjectiveFunctionImpl(batchLossFunction, sampleLossFunction, Arrays.asList(dimensionLossFunctions));
101    }
102
103}
